item.description:
Waterfire website

This event has gotten really popular over the years, and this part of Providence is easy to get to and a nice place to walk around.

Let's meet at the Food Court around 6pm to eat. According to the MBTA schedule, there's a Commuter Rail train that gets to Providence at 5:50pm on Saturday evenings, so that should fit good with this. The next train doesn't come in until 7:50.

After dinner, we will walk along the river and hopefully find a not-so-crowded spot away from the mall to sit close to the river. There is usually some entertainment and food carts along the way, and sometimes even some freebies.

For those of you taking the commuter rail, MBTA trains leave Providence at 7:52pm and 10pm. There also appears to be a few later trains if you want to take Amtrak. I'm not sure about the bus routes.

The fires are lit by boat at sundown, and according to the website they stay lit until midnight.

Here's the weather forecast.

Don't forget your camera! :)
item.how_to_find_us: Food court - I'll email my cell # to the Yes & Maybe RSVPs
item.name: Waterfire in Providence
